channel.title: Stories from curbed.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best curbed.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: Want A Private Island? You Can Have This One With A Historic Cottage For $1.5M
item.description: The one-acre island comes with a well-preserved historic cottage, dock and sandy beach.
item.kicker: WE WANT TO GO TO THERE

item.title: Safe As Houses
item.description: Americans have always designed our living spaces to respond to threats both real and imagined.

item.title: My Year Of Free Mattresses
item.description: I slept on a new one every 100 nights, but I couldn't scam my way to self-care.

item.title: 'If Thousands Of People Couldn't Pay Rent April 1, We'll Have Millions In May'
item.description: Twelve percent more Americans didn't pay rent in April; what happens in May?

item.title: The Midcentury Home Drake Demolished To Build His Toronto Mansion
item.description: The razed house was a 1963 design from a pioneering modernist.
item.kicker: IF YOU'RE SEEING THIS, IT'S TOO LATE

item.title: Finding Beautiful Baby Decor In A Sea Of Plastic
item.description: It turns out there are beautiful things for babies. It's also true that these are, for the most part, the most expensive baby items on the market.

item.title: What I Wish I'd Known Before Buying A Foreclosed Home
item.description: A first-time homeowner shares her experience buying a HUD foreclosure and her tips for anyone considering this type of purchase.

item.title: The Green Dream Of Portland
item.description: Decades ago, Portland, Oregon established an image as the most environmentally friendly city in the world. But is the progressive city's progress still too slow?

item.title: Coronavirus Closures Are Making It Even Harder To Access Public Space
item.description: It's okay to go outside under stay-at-home orders, but whether it's safe depends on where you live.

item.title: How To Reach Out To Neighbors Who Need It
item.description: Safe ways to contact seniors, at-risk neighbors and others needing social connection during a challenging time.

item.title: Coronavirus Rent Crisis: 'Millions Will Have Trouble Paying Rent'
item.description: The profound economic fallout from efforts to stop the spread have made paying for housing a matter of national importance.

item.title: Vintage Airstream Renovated Into 170-Square-Foot Roving Home
item.description: The soothing space boasts a new floorplan, eggshell blue cabinets, and stainless steel countertops.

item.title: What The 1918 Pandemic Can Teach Cities About Public Spaces Today
item.description: Lessons on restricting public spaces and social interaction in the age of coronavirus.
item.kicker: LIVE AND LEARN BEFORE IT'S TOO LATE

item.title: The Fascinating History Of Flokati, The Original Shag Rug
item.description: How the coziest carpets went from Alexander the Great's tents to your living room.

item.title: How Coronavirus Will Impact The Housing Market
item.description: The economy is grinding to a halt. Will the housing market follow?

item.title: The Pros And Cons Of Homeownership In 2020
item.description: Homeownership used to be part of the American dream. Now it's both a dream and a nightmare.

item.title: Why We Can't Build Small Homes Anymore
item.description: The American obsession with large homes, a matter of culture, policy, and economics, restricts smaller, more affordable options.

item.title: The World's Most Beautiful Homes Are Also Down To Earth
item.description: The new book The Art of Earth Architecture explores one of the oldest — and most ecologically sensitive — building techniques.

item.title: Reno Gambled With Tesla. Affordable Housing Paid The Price
item.description: The last hurrah for Harrah's says a lot about the changing face of Reno, Nevada.

item.title: The Affordable Housing Crisis, Explained
item.description: Market forces, policy decisions and demographic changes have converged, making it more difficult to increase affordable housing for renters and buyers in US cities.

item.title: Our Intersections Are Too Dangerous. Here's How To Fix Them
item.description: Engineers to advocates share advice for transforming your street corner.

item.title: The Teenagers Who Live Alone
item.description: For teenagers, living alone can be a crash course in independence.

item.title: The Invention Of The Bachelor Pad
item.description: And why are there still so few visions of comfortable, livable interiors for men?

item.title: Minimalist Prefab Keeps The Spotlight On Nature
item.description: The sleek Birdbox retreat is available as a vacation rental and for purchase

item.title: This Modern Home Slots Into A Void In The Landscape
item.description: The two-story rectangular house slots into the void like a mismatched puzzle piece.

item.title: The Best Cities To Invest In Real Estate In 2020
item.description: Home values in these five cities are predicted to rise over the long term, making them top picks if you're interested in real estate investment.

item.title: For These Postmodern Houses, Less Is A Bore
item.description: A new book explores one of the 20th century's most maligned—and misunderstood—design movements.

item.title: The Case For Keeping Things
item.description: We live in a throwaway society, but our objects deserve better.

item.title: Fridges Are Not Cool
item.description: My not-so-chill quest for a new refrigerator.

item.title: Are Candles Toxic?
item.description: Turns out, burning anything indoors — whether candles, incense or sage — is bad for you.

item.title: Dying Malls Seek Second Life As Entertainment Destinations
item.description: As Americans increasingly shop online and stay at home, can malls find new community appeal?

item.title: The Couples That Choose To Live Separately
item.description: Google "living apart together" and you'll find a dizzying number of articles, most focused on whether this behavior is socially acceptable or good for a relationship.

item.title: When Living Apart Keeps You Together
item.description: Those who follow "living apart together" look to prioritize individualism and moments of intentional solitude as features of longterm relationships, not roadblocks to togetherness.

item.title: The 10 Best Places To Live In The US In 2020
item.description: Curbed dug deep into different criteria — like jobs, housing costs, and walkability — to find the 10 best cities to live in right now.

item.title: Large Garage Cleverly Transformed Into Flexible Backyard Home
item.description: The finished result, which recently won an American Institute of Architects local award last month, is a full-service home with an open kitchen and living room, bedroom, bathroom, and plenty of opportunities for reconfiguration.

item.title: Cane Furniture Is Back — But It Never Really Left
item.description: Cane is a pliable material that gives a touch of "naturalness" to any setting, something especially appealing in tech-filled spaces.

item.title: Playhouse Flippers: DIY Toy Houses Are Reaching New Heights
item.description: Parents are creating strikingly realistic — and shockingly stylish — toy houses for toddlers.

item.title: Will Upzoning Neighborhoods Make Homes More Affordable?
item.description: Cities and states across the country are proposing new upzoning laws to combat the housing crisis. Will they work?
item.kicker: HOME, HOME IN MY PRICE RANGE

item.title: How To End Traffic
item.description: European cities offer a roadmap for life with fewer cars.

item.title: A Perfectly Simple Cabin Rises In The Wilderness
item.description: Sometimes a home is best left to simplicity. In the case of this Vermont cabin, Seattle-based architecture firm Olson Kundig wanted to design a house that didn't detract from its abundantly wooded surroundings.

item.title: How Better Bus Lanes Can Fix Everyone's Commute
item.description: New York's 14th Street Busway suggests better transit leads to more riders, fewer cars on the road, and cleaner air for everyone.

item.title: I Lost Myself Within My Married Household. I Found Myself By Creating My Own
item.description: How living alone changed me — and the way I thought about home decor.

item.title: The Deadliest City For Pedestrians Has A Plan For Safer Streets — Will It Work?
item.description: At ground zero of the pedestrian safety crisis, a mayor's traffic reform goals are put to the test.

item.title: Indigenous Design Techniques To Mine For The Future
item.description: A new book explores what we can learn from people who have mastered living with the land for millennia.

item.title: Sound And The City
item.description: Urban silence is increasingly endangered — and primarily available to those who can pay for it.

item.title: How Buying A House Activated All Of My Anxieties
item.description: Purchasing a home means phone calls — and late-night worries about gentrification.

item.title: My Dad Is A Real Bob The Builder
item.description: I spent my childhood observing my dad at work, but I didn't understand everything that went into it until we began a project together.
item.kicker: CAN HE FIX IT? YES HE CAN!

item.title: Muji's New Prefab Home Designed For Aging In Place
item.description: As expected, everything about the Yō no Ie House is muted. Pale wood floors and white walls create a soothing atmosphere. It's just the type of house that would be perfect for new, discerning home owners on a budget. Unfortunately, the Yō no Ie House is only available in Japan for now, selling for $160,000.

item.title: The Five Most Impressive Prefab Homes Of 2019
item.description: Inventive and ready to order, these designs range from stylish backyard dwellings to a sleek floating home.

item.title: How #VanLife Millennials Changed Mobile Living In The 2010s
item.description: Over the past ten years, the #VanLife hashtag has spawned a lifestyle movement, brought new blood into the RV industry, and inspired over six million Instagram posts.
